intro: Dortmanna phyllostachya, commonly known as the silver feather grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and delicate, feathery plumes that give it a soft, ethereal appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or pale yellow, arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered in a fine layer of silvery hair, contributing to its common name. Dortmanna phyllostachya thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
